alert.note: Alert for Cowley (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 31 at 11:49PM CDT until June 04 at 12:21AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Kansas, including the following counties, Cowley and Sumner. * WHEN...Until 915 AM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is likely occurring. Low-water crossings are likely inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1141 PM CDT, doppler radar estimates indicated very heavy rainfall amounts ranging from 2 to 5 inches that occurred earlier in the evening, with additional thunderstorms possible overnight. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Arkansas City, Winfield, Wellington, Mulvane, Belle Plaine, Oxford, Udall, Burden, South Haven, Dexter, Atlanta, Geuda Springs, Rock, Cambridge, Hunnewell, Strother Field Airport, Winfield City Lake, Wellington Airport, Riverdale and Perth.
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
